text: is a city in Osaka Prefecture, Japan. The Japanese word Ibaraki means Wild Trees or Thorny trees in English. There is also an Ibaraki Prefecture in Japan. It has been recognized as a special city since 2001.Jacobs, A.J. "Japan's Evolving Nested Municipal Hierarchy: The Race for Local Power in the 2000s," Urban Studies Research (2011), Table 3; retrieved 2012-12-18. ==History== The city was founded on January 1, 1948. == Sister and Friendship cities == * Minneapolis, Minnesota, United States - Sister city since 1980 * Anqing, Anhui, China - Friendship city since 1985 * Shodoshima, Kagawa, Japan - Sister city since 1988 ==References== ==Other websites== * Ibaraki official website Category:Cities in Osaka Prefecture
title: Ibaraki, Osaka
